I support @SpeakerPelosi's formal impeachment inquiry. We need to protect our national security and the rule of law. President Trump cannot ask a foreign leader to dig up dirt on political opponents. This is illegal, unpatriotic, and against the values our country was founded on. https://twitter.com/scottwongDC/status/1176599424878989313 …

Knowing what we know now, we must move forward with a formal #impeachment investigation before President Trump disrupts our next Presidential election – by openly and illegally seeking assistance from a foreign power. The eyes of future generations are watching.

Before revelations regarding Ukraine came to light, the contents of the #MuellerReport and the President's continuous actions to block Congressional investigations were enough to begin impeachment proceedings. That's why I voted to stop Republican efforts to end that process.

Our foundation begins and ends with the rule of law. Those who take an oath to uphold the Constitution have a duty to protect what we stand for. I do not take this lightly, and I believe that we need to do something about it. https://matsui.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=1892 …

The willingness of @realDonaldTrump to break the law and the brazen nature of his pursuit of power underscores the gravity of this moment in history. I am a proud supporter of the Green New Deal and equally proud of #Sac's youth for being bold. https://www.sacbee.com/opinion/op-ed/article235194872.html …

3/ Make no mistake; the California waiver creates jobs, saves consumers money at the pump, and keeps families healthier. Revoking our waiver erodes those goals and cedes U.S. leadership in auto manufacturing, and I believe we are better than that.

2/ We all deserve clean air to breathe, but unfortunately, @realDonaldTrump and @EPAAWheeler would rather lower air standards and increase rates of sickness in all fifty states. Let's demand #CleanerCars and cleaner air.

We cannot allow this to stand. That's why I will work with my colleagues to investigate the decision to weaponize the DOJ, block Trump's dirty car rule from going into effect, and protect California's right to regulate its own air quality.

Trump would rather splinter the U.S. auto market than compromise and enforce a clean air and fuel economy standard that protects the American people. This will cost us jobs, exacerbate climate change, and it will further endanger the health and well-being of our communities.

To reach a fuel economy and air quality deal that balances our public health, economic, and environmental needs, we all need to work together. From the onset, the @CAgovernor has done that by being a good-faith negotiator and willing to compromise, but the federal govt has not.

Trump is abusing the power of the fed govt to push an agenda that damages our environment and public health.
